message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $90. It's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll love it!
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $80. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

I understand you're interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go down to $80 just yet. However, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering it to you for $85. It's a great compromise, and I think you'll find it's still a fantastic deal!
I'm still interested in the product, but I was thinking $82 would be a fair price. Can you consider that?

I'm getting close to your price, Bob! I'm willing to give you a bit more, but I'm not going to give away the farm. I'm offering it to you for $87. It's still a great deal, and I think you'll find it's worth it!
I'm getting closer to the price I'm willing to pay, but I still think $84 is a fair price. Can you consider that?
I'm not willing to go all the way to $84, Bob, but I'm willing to meet you halfway again. I'm offering it to you for $86. It's a great compromise, and I think you'll find it's still a fantastic deal!
I'm still not convinced that $86 is the right price. I'm willing to meet you halfway again, but I'll only go up to $83. Can you consider that?
I'm not willing to go all the way to $83, Bob, but I'm willing to give you a bit more. I'm offering it to you for $88. It's getting close to my minimum, but I think it's still a great deal!
I'm not willing to pay $88, and I'm getting close to my budget. I'll make one final offer: $85. If you won't accept this, I'll have to consider buying from John for $150.
